@SpreadingTheSheets Huh.. I tought our universe is 4D (3 spatial simention and 1 time dimension). Anyway, imagine if we use this wormhole tech to colonize the universe. If they can only put a wormhole if they have only visited a ace, then colonize atleast mars. Furthermore, SPACE MINING! So much resources that can be gained for a little investment. Unfortinately, that could create an economic rescession, due to the price of raw materials falling overnight. From what I've read, doesn't the Alcubierre drive also need an exotic matter? Are they the same type of exotic matter? Ahh... sorry for posting a useless daydreaming

@DegenerateWithATinyDick The concept of wormholes is pretty interesting to think about. It’s said that these wormholes exists in space, and they work by entering from a 3D space, to 4D, and then back out again to 3D, where the entry and exit point are 3Ds. Wormholes would allow for faster than light travel and time travel at it too, and in the story her father was able to harness that power for humanity to use. This type of technology would be revolutionary for teleportation and interuniversal travel, and even for more unethical uses, like what we see here where she uses it for pleasure. And from what we see, the wormhole portal that she used does not need any power of any kind to function - which seems improbable; which means that her father was able to invent some kind of everlasting exotic matter to keep it working. This raises even more questions, but that’s enough science for today

The scientist in me wants to study the hell out of this technology. Teleportation (possible spacetime warping with little to no energy required? Maybe able to develop new propulsion tech, maybe even ftl tech) and breaking the conservation of mass law (a whole new field of physics? Maybe reversing enthropy?). I'm probably wrong about these.
